intro: Senecio trinervius, commonly known as the three-veined senecio, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Senecio trinervius is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
